clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Standing at Different Angles on Transpulmonary Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Standing at Different Angles on Transpulmonary Pressure

brief_summary.textblock: Effects of standing at different angles on transpulmonary pressure

detailed_description.textblock: Objective: To study the effect of different standing angles on cross-lung pressure.Background: Long-term bed rest in ICU patients leads to upward movement of diaphragm and increased intrathoracic pressure in mechanically ventilated patients, resulting in lower cross-lung pressure. If the end-expiratory cross-lung pressure is negative, lung tissue compression and atelectasis will occur.Standing can lower the diaphragm, improve the pressure across the lungs, and improve ventilation.Selection methods: patients with invasive mechanical ventilation in the ICU, on the premise of stable hemodynamics, with the aid of electric bed training in standing in different angles, start from 20 degrees, 5 degrees up every five minutes, the largest up to 80 degrees, each Angle across the pulmonary pressure, die cavity ratio, tidal volume and breathe out carbon dioxide at the end of the record, and record whether low blood pressure, an accident in the process of take off the tube and other adverse reactions.

primary_outcome.description: End-expiratory pressure across the lungs is recommended at 0-5cmH2O.
The change in esophageal pressure represents the degree of inspiratory effort.The greater the variation, the harder the inhale.
Standard tidal volume: standard weight based on height, 6 to 8ml per kg body weight

primary_outcome.measure: partial pressure of carbon dioxide in endexpiratory gas
primary_outcome.description: The smaller the difference between pCO2 and arterial blood gas, the better

secondary_outcome.description: hypotension、Accident to take off the tube、Drop of bed，Record the number of times it happens.The more it happens, the less safe it is.

arm_group.description: Assist the electric hospital bed to conduct different Angle standing training, starting from 20 degrees, every five minutes to rise 5 degrees, the maximum rise to 80 degrees

intervention.description: Change the patient's standing Angle by using an electric bed
